tasks.task: Examining and managing a sustainable shrimp farming setup
subtasks: Introducing the biofilter to control water chemistry
Visualizing the solar panels powering the water pumps
Observing the shrimp growth environment with mesh-covered substrates
Describing the daily feeding routine using sinking fish feed
Explaining the expected shrimp yield and duration
Referencing the project website for backyard shrimp farming
Detailing cost breakdown and time frame for potential farmers
Discussing the acquisition of juvenile shrimp and stocking rates
Highlighting the natural and marketable aspect of the farming method

tasks.task: Interviewing Brent Hood about sustainable shrimp farm components
subtasks: Asking about the purpose of the SAR grant for sustainable shrimp research
Discussing the biofilter's role in maintaining water quality
Inquiring about the solar panel installations and their benefits
Examining the pool design for shrimp habitat and feeding systems
Getting information on the feeding schedule and type of feed used
Clarifying the expected shrimp size and growth time
Interacting with the project website and its educational resources
Exploring the budget and timeline for aspiring backyard farmers
Discussing the source of juvenile shrimp for the farm
Emphasizing the natural and market-friendly aspects of the product
